sub_title: Operational Manager - Brakes Division at Advanced Performance Parts B.V.
summary:
With more than 10 years’ experience in sales in various environments ranging from B2C sales on the actual shop floor as well as B2B sales and setting up wholesalers and distributors worldwide, I’ve become adapt in customer loyalty, relationship and value management. 

Moreover, while my on-the-job experience has afforded me a well-rounded skill set, including first-rate analytical and communication skills. I have developed strong organizational skills that allow me to multi-task, work on multiple projects simultaneously and excel at increasing customer loyalty and growing repeat business.

I'm known for rooting out inefficiencies, incorrect procedures or detrimental practices and implementing cross-departmental collaboration from a technical sales point of view while simultaneously motivating others to increase their knowledge, excel at their job and achieve personal goals.

People describe me as passionate, knowledgeable and loyal.

education.field_of_study: International Business and Management Studies ( IBMS )

profile_positions.description:
As the Operational Manager of the brakes division at Advanced Performance Parts B.V. I have the pleasure of working with a dedicated and highly skilled team of our wholesale distribution business for car brakes. I oversee various aspects of our operations, ensuring the efficient and smooth operation of the brakes division, with the ultimate goal of delivering superior products and services to our customers.

Advanced Performance Parts B.V. is a leading wholesale distribution company specializing in high-quality car components. With a strong commitment to delivering top-notch products and exceptional customer service, we have established ourselves as a trusted partner in the automotive industry.
profile_positions.title: Operational Manager - Brakes Division

profile_positions.description:
Brand Manager for Advanced Performance Parts B.V.
– Developer & project leader of custom brake solutions and new product lines.
– Digital marketing manager of online communications & social media.

2019 – Establishment of APP's own brand of custom brake solutions.
2018 – Establishment of new online retail distribution channel for Europe (www.brakes-shop.com).
2017 – Establishment & execution of new European retail online marketing strategy.

Advanced Performance Parts B.V. based in the Netherlands is the official main distributor for StopTech Braking Systems in Europe. With an unparalleled level of research and development with our partners in North America and our own engineers, we continually innovate and expand our knowledge in brake technology for the street and track, providing our customers the best of the best when it comes to braking.

Our clients have access to not only the largest StopTech warehouse in Europe but also a majority of products Advanced Performance Parts B.V. offers, including Centric Brake Components, GiroDisc Brakes and others. Combined giving our dealers the opportunity to provide their customers with the best possible brake set up at several different price ranges. We basically deliver every brake component, which you could require, for almost every car from every continent.
profile_positions.title: Brand Manager - Brakes Division

profile_positions.description:
International Sales & Product Management, and Representative for StopTech®, the ultra-high performance division of Centric Parts® in Europe. 

- Expansion and growth of B2B customers and the product categories they purchase.
- Account management and optimizing the business relationship.
- Expansion application range, specific for the European market.

2014 - Full-year target: Exceeded
2015 - Full-year target: Exceeded

StopTech® offers a full range of high performance aftermarket brake systems and components for a variety of vehicle applications. From full race to AeroRotor® replacement kits, StopTech® has something for just about everybody.

Advanced Performance Parts Inc, APP Impex Inc, and Advanced Performance Parts BV, are all part of the APP Group of companies, with offices in California, Michigan, the Netherlands, and the U.A.E. We are specialized in 2 specific segments: The supply (with our manufacturing partners) of both high performance components and systems, and accessories, to the vehicle manufacturers such as Toyota (TRD), Lexus (F Sport), GM (Chevrolet Performance), Chrysler (Mopar), Ford (Ford racing), Mazda (Mazdaspeed), Nissan (Nismo), and Subaru (SPT and STi). The sale and distribution of high performance braking systems and other components to more than 65 countries worldwide for both the performance and security industries.
profile_positions.title: International Sales & Product Management

profile_positions.description:
International Account Manager and representative for 12Tune International B.V.

- Expansion and growth of B2B customers and the product categories they purchase.
- Account management and optimizing the business relationship.

12Tune International B.V. is an European importer of a wide variety of tuning & styling parts, with a specialism in JDM car brands, such as Honda, Subaru, Toyota, Mitsubishi and Nissan.

Our activity lies in our Wholesale activities, as we import large volumes of products and distribute them throughout Europe. In contradiction to many others in the market, we actually stock a majority of our products. Next to our own stock, we can offer a lot of products within a short timespan to offer our customers a complete service.

Besides our regular Wholesale activities we offer support on our products to our customers and thus offer great customer satisfaction. Another aspect of our services is to maintain close contact with suppliers and manufacturers. We can oversee certain aspects of quality control and production and improve quality of products where needed.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager International Sales

profile_positions.description:
The responsibilities of an account manager can vary depending on the industry they work in, size of the company, and nature of the business. However, part of my responsibilities where as follows:

- Generate sales for a portfolio of accounts and manage company accounts world-wide.
- Identify new sales opportunities within existing accounts to remain a client-account manager relationship by up-selling and cross-selling.
- Manage and solve conflicts with clients.
- Interact and coordinate with the sales team and other staff members in other departments working on the same account .
profile_positions.title: Junior Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a retail manager I was responsible for the day-to-day running of my store. An overview of some of my responsibilities are as follows:

- Aiming to maximize profit while minimizing costs.
- Ensure promotions are accurate and merchandised to the company’s standard.
- Staff are fully versed on the target for the day and excellent customer care standards are being met.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Shop Manager & Mechanic - Bicycles

profile_positions.description:
As a Technical salesman I used my technical knowledge along with sales skills to provide advice and support on a range of products, for which a certain level of expertise is needed. I assisted my colleagues with their customers and their technical questions as well as handling my own customers from a technical perspective. To sum up some responsibilities and/or activities:

- Providing pre-sales technical assistance and product education.
- Working on after-sales support services and providing technical back up as required.
- Arranging and carrying out product training.
- Meeting regular sales targets.
- Making technical presentations and demonstrating how a product meets client needs.
- Liaising  and providing training and producing support material for other members of the sales team.
profile_positions.title: Technical Salesman

volunteer_experiences.description:
Football coaches develop the knowledge, techniques and motivation of football teams and players.
To become a football coach I needed the Koninklijke Nederlandse Voetbal Bond (KNVB) coaching qualifications and have the energy and enthusiasm to inspire others. You'll also need good communication skills to get your ideas across.


The work; As a football coach you need to:

Plan coaching activities, sessions and programmes.
Provide feedback and give advice on players' performance, fitness and technical skills.
Develop and discuss strategies and tactics for both individual and team play.
Give guidance on nutrition, and injury recognition and prevention.
Research good practice and innovative examples of coaching from around the world.
Advise players on how to keep up a positive mental attitude and self-discipline.
Analyse matches and player performance data.
Design innovative training methods and programmes.
